definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
ten years of practice for one minute on the stage (idiom)
pinyin: tai2 shang4 yi1 fen1 zhong1 , tai2 xia4 shi2 nian2 gong1
containing_words.word: 台上一分钟，台下十年功

sentences.english: When greasy, dirty rags are used to wipe the tables.
sentences.chinese: 餐台下有油脂或脏的胶贴。

sentences.english: The audience even crooned to the rhythm of the songs.
sentences.chinese: 台下的听众跟着歌声低声吟唱。

sentences.english: Off stage schoolmate listens he tirelessly, come to, and act as a précis writer carefully.
sentences.chinese: 台下的同学认真听着他娓娓道来，并做记录。

sentences.english: Noda's the second highest number of votes immediately attracted the audience breathless.
sentences.chinese: 野田的这一第二高得票数顿时引来台下的惊叹声。

sentences.english: Under the stage resounds like the thunder applause immediately.
sentences.chinese: 台下顿时响起如雷掌声。

sentences.english: One minute on the stage needs ten years practice off stage.
sentences.chinese: 台上一分钟，台下十年功。

sentences.english: In the audience, how their lives be friends with Dance?
sentences.chinese: 而在台下，他们的生活又如何与舞结缘呢？

sentences.english: She will be on the stage copying Dorothy, and they will be watching.
sentences.chinese: 她会在舞台上表演多丽丝，他们在台下看着。

sentences.english: Dirty girl, gettin' down, dance with guys from outta town.
